nodes.bodyText: Same comment as for the auto feature above. This is a private feature so it doesn't need translations. If the bundles need translated files then those NLS files would go in the bundle.
We could combine the private features into the public one and not have extra nls files and just have all the icons in the public feature for the private feature.
That's what openidConnectServer-1.0 does right? It still looks odd to me but at least there is precedence
Yeah I am guessing that these nls files are not needed because only public features need a feature description, right?
So this bundle builds differently if being run from the command line vs from eclipse or something else?

nodes.bodyText: I believe this is to make things work well in eclipse without having to run gradle in order to build in eclipse.

nodes.bodyText: I thought that @cbridgha was going to be removing this snapshots repo?
PR #15161 just updated this so now it causes a merge conflict I am sure.
Can these be consolidated under each directory as *.jar instead of listing each jar, i.e. lib/buildtasks/*.jar.  If there are no other file types, it could just be lib/buildtasks/ of course.
I believe for gitignore files, directories are supposed to end with a slash (/)
Have you run without a gradle.startup.properties file or with artifactory.force.external.repo=true in gradle.start.up.properties to confirm that all the necessary artifacts are in maven / dhe?
Don't know if we should reference intranet web sites in open liberty.
Deleting the file because this file still exists in previous repo.
Can this commented out code be removed?

This is an auto feature not a private feature.  It should be in the auto directory and shouldn't be in a separate directory.  Only public features get their own directory.  With recent test updates your PB will fail due to this be in the wrong directory.
The PR to test that things are in the right directory is now in integration, so it will fail with your feature in this format.
Only public features have short names.  They aren't needed for private features.
Can these nls resource files just publish automatically to wlp/lib/features/l10n with the current process instead of a separate task?
Again this is an auto feature, not a private feature, so it will end up failing the new test mentioned in the previous comment.
ShortName doesn't apply to auto features

It is strange to be done as an auto feature since the only filter is adminCenter.  Is there a filter missing?  If not, why not have it be a private feature and just have the adminCenter bring it in as a dependency?
Again why an auto feature instead of adminCenter just depending on this feature.  Is there a filter missing?
adminCenter is in edition core.  Is there a reason this is in edition base?
adminCenter is in edition core.  Any reason this is in edition base?
This should be Java 8.  We do not do Java 7 any longer.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,7 @@

+<classpath>
+	<classpathentry kind="src" path="src"/>
+	<classpathentry kind="con" path="aQute.bnd.classpath.container"/>
+	<classpathentry kind="con" path="org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JRE_CONTAINER/org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.launcher.StandardVMType/JavaSE-1.7"/>

nodes.bodyText: build.gradle files that only have this content are not needed in OL.
We don't use findbugs.exclude.xml files in open liberty.
I don't believe this file is needed in OL.
Weird file.  What is it for?
This used by some parts of Admin Center to detect if another piece of Admin Center is loaded.
Yeah I read .js and thought .js instead of .json.  Sorry
Again what is this file for?
This used by some parts of Admin Center to detect if another piece of Admin Center is loaded.
It is the same with all the other languages for this js file.
This should be 1.8.  We do not do 1.7 any longer.

nodes.bodyText: Copyright is missing.  The rest of the languages are the same comment.
This used by some parts of Admin Center to detect if another piece of Admin Center is loaded.
Copyright is missing.  The same comment for all the languages
Copyright is missing.  Same comment for all the other languages.
With the switch to short name for the private / auto features, you need to update to short name here as well.
visibility for an auto feature is private, so this will not work for auto features to find the files.
In other html files, the copyright comment is not on the first line.  It is here.  Is that a problem?
Similar comment here with the copyright comment being on the first line.
And again here with it being the first line.
Same comment about the copyright being first.

This one does not make sense. It should be 'visibility/' + featureProps['visibility'] + '/' + featureProps['symbolicName'] + '/resources'
This one doesn't do anything so it could be removed.

This one does make sense. It should be 'visibility/' + featureProps['visibility'] + '/' + featureProps['symbolicName'] + '/resources'
This one doesn't do anything do it could be removed.

Right, I didn't want to break existing behavior if another feature had done it that way. So I left it.
There is no existing behavior to be left.  It only did short name before.  I suggest simplifying this like we do for the wlp/lib/features/l10n logic.
I provided Katie some code that got rid of the need to deal with file path manipulation.

I'd rather not be using so many hard-coded versions in here. Where possible, I would like Open Liberty to use just one version of each dependency. It should be easy for us to a) know what our dependencies are and b) update that version in a single place to pull in fixes from upstream.
When I looked in the oss_dependencies.maven file, I was disappointed to find that we have multiple versions of jackson-annotations already.

  
    
      open-liberty/dev/cnf/oss_dependencies.maven
    
    
         Line 11
      in
      544f05a
    
    
    
    

        
          
           com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:2.11.2
after talking to Katie, we will address this in #15902

Similar to my comment above. I'd rather not pull in specific versions here. Instead, use a common bundle and use the same version across Open Liberty. In this case you would put libs project(':io.openliberty.com.fasterxml.jackson') to pull in our existing bundle that includes version 2.11.2.

nodes.bodyText: Slightly confused about what updates to Feature Visibility Tests have to do with admincenter?
This was to support the non public features also being in their own directory.

Why is this auto-feature in a sub-folder? What is the benefit? Why not directly in
dev/com.ibm.websphere.appserver.features/visibility/auto ?
Oh, I see... it's because of the additional NLS properties files. However, an auto-feature is private, it does not need any translation.
It isn't just nls properties files, but also icons needed for the admin center that are stored in the features directory in liberty.
Storing icons (anything) in the features directory is rather unusual? It certainly isn't done for any other private OL feature. Why is this one different?
